results.title: Gardens of Japan
results.creator_credit: Nihon Eiga Shin-sha and Japan Educational Film
results.brief_description:
Some of the scenic beauty of Japan - in nature and in the highly cultivated and famous gardens in Tokyo and Kyoto; a variety of gardens which have been planned and cultivated to please both the mind and the eye, including those using sand and stone to represent natural
landscapes and which have symbolic significance. A short sequence shows the traditional tea ceremony.

results.title: Gardens of Japan
results.creator_credit: Koga Productions, Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Seiji Koga
results.brief_description: Generations of culture in Japan are shown in gardens existing for hundreds of years; varying in form and expression reflecting the influence of the period in which each was built. A temple garden with thick moss and symbolic arrangement of stones; dry landscaping; extravagant and imposing gardens with beautiful lakes reflecting the mountains beyond; peaceful and harmonious settings for the buildings which were set in them.

results.title: Gardening secrets: Summer
results.brief_description: Eion Scarrow, a professional gardener for 40 years, is New Zealand’s best known gardening personality. He and his wife, Ann, own a magnificent display garden in the Waikato, “Willow Glen Gardens”. Using their own garden to demonstrate summer gardening tips, they explain how to care for potted plants when you go away on holidays, how to compost in an open frame structure; care and pruning of citrus trees; mineral deficiencies in the soil; spraying programs and protective equipment for garden pests and diseases; care of variegated plants; deadheading; mulching; safety and care of motor mowers and lawn watering systems and care and preparation of the vegetable garden.

results.title: Gardening secrets: Spring
results.brief_description: In this program devoted to care of the spring garden, well-known New Zealand gardening expert, Eion Scarrow and his wife, Ann, demonstrate the propagation, planting and care of spring vegetables; the planting and care of citrus trees; the pruning of citrus, apples, cherries and camellias; the propagation and potting of indoor plants; basic hydroponics; the preparation and care of a herb garden; broad leaf weed control in lawns; care of garden tools; and summer perennials. Filmed on location at the Scarrow’s garden, Willow Glen, in the Waikato.

results.title: Garden watering systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Do It Yourself Home Video Workshop. Series 1”.
Instructional video that advises the viewer on designing and installing a watering system specifically for their home. It suggests tool and material requirements, offers measurement and design advice and demonstrates the installation of drip, pop-up lawn, garden-bed and automatic watering systems. It also offers some general watering tips.

results.title: Garden plants and how they grow
results.brief_description: Illustrates general principles of plant growth. Examines the interior of a seed; distinguishes plants which store food in their stems, leaves, roots and seed pods; compares plants grown in good and poor soil and in sunlight and shade; shows destructive animals and insects and those which are helpful to plants. Time-lapse photography is used to show the growth of bean seeds.

results.title: Garden party
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gurian, ACI Films and Jack Sholder
results.brief_description: An adaptation of a short story by Katherine Mansfield, presenting a story about a garden party which continues uninterrupted by a neighbourhood death. Helps stimulate discussion on the meaning of death. A sensitive approach to a difficult theme. It is recommended that teachers preview this film before screening.
